title: hello.go: fatal error: can't find import: fmt
body:
by **artemkolesn**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Do all install steps according to http://golang.org/doc/install.html
logged in as user "user"
2. 8g hello.go ==> hello.8 file created (so, it compiles and links for user)
3. Logout
4. Login as "root"
5. Set new $GOBIN variable to /usr/bin/go
6. move all files from /home/user/go/bin to /usr/bin/go
7. go to /root home directory
8. create new hello.go file
9. 8g hello.go

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
epected to get hello.8 file
got fatal error: can't find import: fmt

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
$GOOS = linux
$GOARCH = 386

Which revision are you sync'ed to?  (hg log -l 1)
changeset:   3975:b51fd2d6c160
tag:         tip
user:        Kevin Ballard <kevin@sb.org>
date:        Tue Nov 10 20:05:24 2009 -0800
summary:     Implement new emacs command M-x gofmt

Please provide any additional information below.
All variables are set correctly for root:

export GOROOT=/home/user/go
export GOBIN=/usr/bin/go
export PATH=$PATH:$GOBIN
export GOOS=linux
export GOARCH=386
